Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with part of handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed streaky dark brown; traces of two faded added white bands; exterior: two dilute lines at top of handle zone; dilute vertical line in handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The curve of the cul and the decoration are both consistent with the Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0931) (phase 2)
